screenTip: Configure cluster, link caches to them and go to Summary for configuration generation.
templateTip: Use following template to add a new cluster:
• local - cluster with static ips discovery and pre-configured list of IP addresses.

general.label: Caches
tip: Select caches to start in cluster or add a new cache.

general.label: Discovery
tip: Discovery allows to discover remote nodes in grid.
Addresses may be represented as follows:
<ul>
• Hostname (e.g. host1.com, host2, etc);
• Hostname and port (e.g. host1.com:47500, host2:47502, etc).
• Hostname and port range (e.g. host1.com:47500..47510, host2:47502..47508, etc).
If port is 0 or not provided then default port will be used (depends on discovery SPI configuration).
If port range is provided (e.g. host:port1..port2) the following should be considered:
<ul>
• port1 < port2 should be true;
• Both port1 and port2 should be greater than 0.

fields.label: IP address
tip: IP address of multicast group.

fields.label: Port number
tip: Port number which multicast messages are sent to.

fields.label: Waits for reply
tip: Time in milliseconds IP finder waits for reply to multicast address request.

fields.label: Attempts count
tip: Number of attempts to send multicast address request.
IP finder re-sends request only in case if no reply for previous request is received.

fields.label: Local address
tip: Local host address used by this IP finder.
If provided address is non-loopback then multicast socket is bound to this interface.
If local address is not set or is any local address then IP finder creates multicast sockets for all found non-loopback addresses.

fields.label: Bucket name
tip: Bucket name for IP finder.

fields.label: Note, AWS credentials will be generated as stubs.
Credential
tip: Credential that is used during authentication on the cloud.
Depending on a cloud platform it can be a password or access key.

fields.label: Path to credential
tip: Path to a credential that is used during authentication on the cloud.
Access key or private key should be stored in a plain or PEM file without a passphrase.

fields.label: Identity
tip: Identity that is used as a user name during a connection to the cloud.
Depending on a cloud platform it can be an email address, user name, etc.

fields.label: Provider
tip: Cloud provider to use.

fields.label: Regions
tableTip: List of regions where VMs are located.
If the regions are not set then every region, that a cloud provider has, will be investigated. This could lead to significant performance degradation.
Note, that some cloud providers, like Google Compute Engine, doesn't have a notion of a region. For such providers a call to this method is redundant.
tip: Region where VMs are located.

fields.label: Zones
tableTip: List of zones where VMs are located.
If the zones are not set then every zone from regions, set by {@link #setRegions(Collection)}}, will be taken into account.
Note, that some cloud providers, like Rackspace, doesn't have a notion of a zone. For such providers a call to this method is redundant.
tip: Zone where VMs are located.

fields.label: Project name
tip: Google Cloud Platforms project name.
Usually this is an auto generated project number (ex. 208709979073) that can be found in 'Overview' section of Google Developer Console.

fields.label: Bucket name
tip: Google Cloud Storage bucket name.
If the bucket doesn't exist Ignite will automatically create it.
However the name must be unique across whole Google Cloud Storage and Service Account Id must be authorized to perform this operation.

fields.label: Private key path
tip: Full path to the private key in PKCS12 format of the Service Account.

fields.label: Account id
tip: Service account ID (typically an e-mail address).

fields.label: DB schema should be initialized by Ignite
tip: Flag indicating whether DB schema should be initialized by Ignite or was explicitly created by user.

advanced.label: Atomics configuration
tip: Configuration for atomic data structures.
Atomics are distributed across the cluster, essentially enabling performing atomic operations (such as increment-and-get or compare-and-set) with the same globally-visible value.

fields.label: Backups
tip: Number of backup nodes.

fields.label: Cache mode
tip: Cache modes:
<ul>
• Partitioned - in this mode the overall key set will be divided into partitions and all partitions will be split equally between participating nodes.
• Replicated - in this mode all the keys are distributed to all participating nodes.
• Local - in this mode caches residing on different grid nodes will not know about each other.

fields.label: Sequence reserve
tip: Default number of sequence values reserved for IgniteAtomicSequence instances.
After a certain number has been reserved, consequent increments of sequence will happen locally, without communication with other nodes, until the next reservation has to be made.

advanced.label: Communication
tip: Cluster communication network properties.

fields.label: Timeout
tip: Maximum timeout in milliseconds for network requests.

fields.label: Send retry delay
tip: Interval in milliseconds between message send retries.

fields.label: Send retry count
tip: Message send retries count.

fields.label: Segment check frequency
tip: Network segment check frequency in milliseconds.
If 0, periodic segment check is disabled and segment is checked only on topology changes (if segmentation resolvers are configured).

fields.label: Wait for segment on start
tip: Wait for segment on start flag.
<ul>
• If enabled, node should wait for correct segment on start.
• If node detects that segment is incorrect on startup and enabled, node waits until segment becomes correct.
• If segment is incorrect on startup and disabled, exception is thrown.

fields.label: Discovery startup delay
tip: This value is used to expire messages from waiting list whenever node discovery discrepancies happen.

advanced.label: Deployment
tip: Task and resources deployment in cluster.

fields.label: Mode
tip: Task classes and resources sharing mode.

advanced.label: Events
tip: Grid events are used for notification about what happens within the grid.

fields.label: Include type
tip: Array of event types, which will be recorded by GridEventStorageManager#record(Event).
Note, that either the include event types or the exclude event types can be established.

advanced.label: Marshaller
tip: Marshaller allows to marshal or unmarshal objects in grid.
It provides serialization/deserialization mechanism for all instances that are sent across networks or are otherwise serialized.

fields.label: Marshaller
tip: Instance of marshaller to use in grid. If not provided, OptimizedMarshaller will be used on Java HotSpot VM, and JdkMarshaller will be used on other VMs.

fields.label: Streams pool size
tip: Specifies size of cached object streams used by marshaller.
Object streams are cached for performance reason to avoid costly recreation for every serialization routine.
If 0 (default), pool is not used and each thread has its own cached object stream which it keeps reusing.
Since each stream has an internal buffer, creating a stream for each thread can lead to high memory consumption if many large messages are marshalled or unmarshalled concurrently.
Consider using pool in this case. This will limit number of streams that can be created and, therefore, decrease memory consumption.
NOTE: Using streams pool can decrease performance since streams will be shared between different threads which will lead to more frequent context switching.

fields.label: Require serializable
tip: Whether marshaller should require Serializable interface or not.

fields.label: Marshal local jobs
tip: If this flag is enabled, jobs mapped to local node will be marshalled as if it was remote node.

fields.label: Keep alive time
tip: Keep alive time of thread pool that is in charge of processing marshaller messages.

fields.label: Pool size
tip: Default size of thread pool that is in charge of processing marshaller messages.

advanced.label: Metrics
tip: Cluster runtime metrics settings.

fields.label: Elapsed time
tip: Time in milliseconds after which a certain metric value is considered expired.

fields.label: History size
tip: Number of metrics kept in history to compute totals and averages.

fields.label: Log frequency
tip: Frequency of metrics log print out. To disable set to 0

fields.label: Update frequency
tip: Job metrics update frequency in milliseconds.
<ul>
• If set to -1 job metrics are never updated.
• If set to 0 job metrics are updated on each job start and finish.
• Positive value defines the actual update frequency.

advanced.label: Peer Class Loading
tip: Cluster peer class loading settings.

fields.label: Enable peer class loading
tip: Enables/disables peer class loading.

fields.label: Local class path exclude
tip: List of packages separated by comma from the system classpath that need to be peer-to-peer loaded from task originating node.
'*' is supported at the end of the package name which means that all sub-packages and their classes are included like in Java package import clause.

fields.label: Missed resources cache size
tip: If size greater than 0, missed resources will be cached and next resource request ignored.
If size is 0, then request for the resource will be sent to the remote node every time this resource is requested.

fields.label: Pool size
tip: Thread pool size to use for peer class loading.

advanced.label: Swap
tip: Settings for overflow data to disk if it cannot fit in memory.

fields.label: Swap space SPI
tip: Provides a mechanism in grid for storing data on disk.
Ignite cache uses swap space to overflow data to disk if it cannot fit in memory.

fields.label: Base directory
tip: Base directory where to write files.

fields.label: Read stripe size
tip: Read stripe size defines number of file channels to be used concurrently.

fields.label: Maximum sparsity
tip: This property defines maximum acceptable wasted file space to whole file size ratio.
When this ratio becomes higher than specified number compacting thread starts working.

fields.label: Max write queue size
tip: Max write queue size in bytes.
If there are more values are waiting for being written to disk then specified size, SPI will block on store operation.

fields.label: Write buffer size
tip: Write buffer size in bytes.
Write to disk occurs only when this buffer is full.

advanced.label: Time configuration
tip: Time settings for CLOCK write ordering mode.

fields.label: Samples size
tip: Number of samples used to synchronize clocks between different nodes.
Clock synchronization is used for cache version assignment in CLOCK order mode.

fields.label: Frequency
tip: Frequency at which clock is synchronized between nodes, in milliseconds.
Clock synchronization is used for cache version assignment in CLOCK order mode.

fields.label: Port base
tip: Time server provides clock synchronization between nodes.
Base UPD port number for grid time server. Time server will be started on one of free ports in range.

fields.label: Port range
tip: Time server port range.

advanced.label: Thread pools size
tip: Settings for node thread pools.

fields.label: Public
tip: Thread pool that is in charge of processing ComputeJob, GridJobs and user messages sent to node.

fields.label: System
tip: Thread pool that is in charge of processing internal system messages.

fields.label: Management
tip: Thread pool that is in charge of processing internal and Visor ComputeJob, GridJobs.

fields.label: IGFS
tip: Thread pool that is in charge of processing outgoing IGFS messages.

advanced.label: Transactions
tip: Settings for transactions.

fields.label: Concurrency
tip: Cache transaction concurrency to use when one is not explicitly specified.

fields.label: Isolation
tip: Default transaction isolation.

fields.label: Default timeout
tip: Default transaction timeout.

fields.label: Pessimistic log cleanup delay
tip: Delay, in milliseconds, after which pessimistic recovery entries will be cleaned up for failed node.

fields.label: Pessimistic log size
tip: Size of pessimistic transactions log stored on node in order to recover transaction commit if originating node has left grid before it has sent all messages to transaction nodes.

fields.label: Manager lookup
tip: Class name of transaction manager finder for integration for JEE app servers.

fields.label: Enable serializable cache transactions
tip: Flag to enable/disable isolation level for cache transactions.
Serializable level does carry certain overhead and if not used, should be disabled.
